file_content.text: The monitoring device, the messages, Lord Kyrus' inside knowledge. Our traitor can work our communications system.
Perhaps someone has communications experience they haven't disclosed.
Is anyone a comm expert?
Alauni can handle a dozen messages at once, maybe it's her.
So who uses the comm system the most?
We look for a frequent user.
I can't stake out the comm system and hope to catch them in the act.
That's not very helpful.
Perhaps not, but if we knew who used the system the most, that would be a start.
Alauni! She's always getting news from her world.
No, no, Alauni sticks to her personal channel. Tai only got a call or two before he left; Duin never speaks to anyone....
A Selkath could easily avoid suspicion, after what the Empire did to them.
Maybe Shuuru? The Selkath?
Mmm. Maybe before Attis Station, but now Shuuru won't hear a word against you.
I'm drawing a blank.
You know, Blaesus gets an awful lot of work from the Erigorm Bureaucracy. And a lot of calls.
Come to think of it, what does Blaesus do with his free time?
Does Blaesus?
He's always busy; the Erigorm Bureaucracy sends him a lot of work... through our communications array.
Wait. When you were on Hoth and someone leaked those messages, Blaesus was sending reports everywhere. What if he alerted the Empire then?
Even if Blaesus isn't responsible, he could point us in the right direction.
We should talk to him.
Wait here, I'll see where he's got to.
We can't condemn a man on such tenuous evidence.
That isn't proof.
No, but shouldn't we at least talk to him before we go anywhere else?
Blaesus couldn't conspire to tie someone's shoelaces together.
Blaesus? Seriously?
Most people think I'm completely harmless, too.
No. It... it couldn't be Blaesus. I just sent him on a mission.
I meant to surprise you, Nadia. King Sethun and Queen Nyscha themselves are donating a regiment to the Republic.
This king and queen are your homeworld's rulers?
Your planet's royal family?
Yes, yes, that's right.
What does Blaesus have to do with this?
How is Blaesus connected?
Snap out of it and explain!
The royal family wanted to heal relations between the Rift Alliance and the Republic, they thought donating troops would help.
They planned a ceremony on Waypoint Station Three to present you with the soldiers.
But you were needed on Hoth... so I sent Blaesus as our envoy. He's with the king and queen right now.
Tell the royals to stay with their soldiers until I arrive.
Warn the royal family.
Put me through to Blaesus at once.
Call him.
There's no answer. Jedi, what have I done?
Someone has to protect those people.
I have to save them.
Captain Valon has ships; I can tell him to guard the royal family until we arrive.
I'll contact Tai. His droids could guard the royal family until we get there.
Be sure he knows our suspicions, just in case.
And tell him about Blaesus.
Hurry. Everyone on that station could be in danger.
Do it fast.
Will do, Jedi. Let's go.
If I've harbored a serpent aboard my ship, I'll be the one to kill it.
No. Blaesus is mine.
I understand, Jedi. We should hurry.
Quite... quite a story, Jedi.
If we'd known the pirates had such technology... At least you were there to make the mission a success.
A "success"? You not only recruited this Captain Valon--you let him run free!
I had the chance to spare him and make him useful, so I took it.
Jedi do not kill the helpless.
But now you command a powerful privateer, and Valon gets to keep his life.
This way, everybody wins.
Don't question me!
Alauni, we've got a pirate king fighting the Empire for us! Isn't that better than killing him?
We appreciate what you've done, but to be honest, I would have preferred this "Valon" dead rather than imprisoned.
He was at my mercy. The Jedi Code required I spare him for judgment.
Jedi do not kill the helpless.
Regardless, the pirate threat is eliminated and your soldiers are safe.
But my task is complete.
I rescued your men, stopped the pirates and handed Valon to you. What more do you want?
You're never happy, are you?
True. And our soldiers are safe because of you. That's all that matters.
We're forgetting someone. Good work, Lieutenant Iresso. We'll make sure the Republic rewards you before you're reassigned.
Actually, sir, as a reward, you could persuade my superiors to assign me here. If that's okay.
It'd be an honor to serve with you. Plus an extra blaster never goes amiss, right?
There's most certainly a place for you here, Lieutenant.
I'd welcome you.
Thanks. That's a... warmer reception than I've had in a while.
Thanks. I like the way you get things done.
This isn't exactly a career-building mission.
You won't get promoted here...
Uh, heh. That's okay. I think my career is... I'll survive.
Won't your superior officers get angry if you start picking your own assignments?
The Republic might object.
You mean the same superior officers who stuck me on Hoth? Hey, I'll risk it!
Excellent, it's settled then. I'm sorry, could you all excuse us for a moment?
You mentioned someone on Hoth was sending the Empire information about you.
Perhaps Private Kree was just desperate enough to alert the Empire.
We did have a mutineer...
Have you discovered who it was?
You have a lead?
I think it was someone on board.
It meant the enemy was always one step ahead.
And it nearly got me killed.
Since I found that monitoring device, I've been watching our communications.
I spotted a message to the Empire, in amongst other messages while the channels were busy! But I can't trace who sent it.
We're just getting clearance for Hoth, Jedi. Won't be a minute.
Clearance! Republic bureaucracy. Do we look like pirates?
The Republic has a right to be careful. The White Maw is cunning, and a vast, frozen wasteland is quite the place to hide.
Who or what is the "White Maw"?
The White Maw?
The Jedi Archives say Hoth is the coldest inhabited planet in the galaxy. Nothing but ice and snow.
"Wasteland" is correct.
They forgot pirates, s-scavengers and monsters.
If the Republic were more welcoming, they might get allies to handle their pirate problem.
The Republic's overcautious.
The White Maw is the largest pirate band in the galaxy. A splinter group has been attacking the shipping lanes to our worlds.
We sent a coalition force of our best soldiers to fight them, but somehow, our men have suffered defeat after defeat.
And the Republic won't "waste" more men to save them. Fools. Now there's a risk of mutiny; our coalition might abandon Hoth altogether.
How is it this "White Maw" is giving your soldiers so much trouble?
But pirates aren't that tough.
The reports we've had are very s-strange. None of them make sense.
And my role is...?
They've already failed. Your soldiers should get out while they can.
Just let the coalition leave.
That's not an option, Jedi. Hoth's a vital strategic position.
We're giving you command of our coalition force. Find out what's happening, and get rid of those pirates so our men can come home.
The only soldier still bothering to send a daily report is Lieutenant Felix Iresso, the officer in charge. He's at the Republic base.
With a little help, your coalition will finish those pirates and get out safely.
Together, we will succeed.
There. That's what we've been hoping to hear.
I'll begin there.
Your soldiers might need a little Jedi discipline.
I'll get your men in line.
Ah, there's our clearance.
Be careful, Jedi. Quite aside from the White Maw, Hoth's cold enough to freeze you solid.
Jedi, we... can already guess what this is about.
We'd like to formally apologize for keeping Attis Station classified from you.
Mistrust is a luxury we cannot afford.
We must learn from this.
I... regret not taking that to heart sooner.
There's no shame in doing what you believe to be right.
It's okay.
We were still wrong.
Because of your stubbornness, the chance to save many lives was lost.
You failed your own people.
Don't you think--we can never forget it.
P--please don't be angry with us. We're very grateful you saved the, um, station.
And think of the m--military funding we can get with that weapons program!
Though if we're working for peace, better not invest too heavily in war.
Though we'll need, um... twice the guards to protect that medical research from the Empire.
Spend the credits and hire them. Those medicines could be an investment for years.
If you've all quite finished, the Jedi and I have matters to discuss. Alone.
Thank you, for protecting my Nadia.
She told me you saw her... outburst. I imagine you want an explanation.
Her talents appear... unique. What is she?
Please enlighten me.
I was almost hoping you could tell me.
She uses her powers instinctively, when she becomes emotional.
I saw she can't control it.
Yes, yes. But Nadia's gotten better at controlling herself.
You condemn the others for hiding Attis Station, but you were hiding Nadia's abilities from me.
Everyone's keeping secrets!
I know, I know. There's no excuse.
The Republic calls them "Force abilities," but to me they're "Nadia's gifts." Her powers are stronger than many Jedi, but... unpredictable.
I hoped she would learn from you. From your experience.
I know what Nadia's going through. My own Force abilities manifested quite early.
I was a prodigy myself.
Yes, yes, exactly, so I knew you'd understand.
It's not uncommon for powerful Force sensitivity to run in families.
Are you "gifted" too?
Me? No, no, I don't have these powers, nor anyone we know back home. Nadia's special.
Nadia might benefit from some basic Jedi instruction.
Perhaps I could train her.
In time, certainly. But for now, I think she has some growing up to do.
An untrained Force adept is incredibly dangerous. You've endangered everyone by keeping her aboard.
She's a threat.
No, Nadia would never hurt someone close to her. I swear.
My daughter looks up to you. Please, keep being her example.
Nadia's very fond of you. Please, be there for her as she gets through this.
Now. Attis Station's researchers said a "Lord Kyrus" contacted you. Didn't he order the attack on the Fortitude, where we all met?
Lord Kyrus has been monitoring us since we we left the Fortitude.
And has watched ever since.
The Sith claimed he knew everything we've done here.
Kyrus has been spying.
Somehow Kyrus knew exactly what you said to me before I left.
He could quote you.
That monitoring device Nadia found. It seems we do have a traitor on board.
I should be able to sense any treachery through the Force.
But I feel no deceit here.
Naturally. Still, the evidence is there.
If they've stayed hidden this long, we'll need more evidence to determine who they are.
We must be vigilant, and wait.
Yes, yes, that seems very sensible.
If you've seen any of the diplomats acting suspiciously, tell me now.
Any idea who it could be?
I'm sorry, Jedi, but to me, everyone aboard acts strangely.
Perhaps if we act normally, our "guest" will leave another clue.
In the meantime, there may be another way for you to help the Rift Alliance. A group of our soldiers on Hoth has run into a... difficult situation.
If you believe I can help, then please, go on.
I'm at your service.
What do you mean by "difficult situation"?
Are these soldiers alright?
It seems I can't earn the Rift Alliance's respect no matter what I do.
Nothing will earn their trust.
Didn't you see the others' faces? Don't lose hope now!
Hoth is infested with pirates who harass our shipping lanes. So we formed a coalition force to handle them.
A quick mission, we thought. But those pirates just can't be defeated, and the Republic won't spare any help.
How could a group of pirates survive against a powerful coalition force?
The pirates are that good?
We're not sure. The reports we have from Hoth are... odd.
I think this bears investigation.
An intriguing situation.
I'll help, but the other diplomats had better appreciate it.
As long as this gets results.
We can explain more when we arrive at Hoth. Until then, watch your back, Jedi.
I'd better keep this brief. What do you know of a world called Quesh?
Are you hiding something from the other diplomats?
Wait, why the secrecy?
Not, er, not exactly.
Virtually nothing.
Hurry this up.
Quesh is a contested planet, simply overflowing with valuable chemicals. So the Rift Alliance built a research facility there. Attis Station.
The station has developed amazing healing technology. Some new weapons, too.
But they've dropped out of contact--and Imperial troops were sighted nearby. The others... didn't want you to know.
Thank you for bringing this information to me.
I'm glad you disagreed.
They're still "deciding the best course of action." Hmph. Isn't that what they accuse the Republic of always doing?
I hoped I'd proven myself by helping Balmorra.
Don't they trust me?
Unfortunately, their "we've been neglected" attitude is hard to shake off.
They chose to hide Attis Station's existence from me. Why should I concern myself with its fate?
Then let them handle this.
Please, Jedi, this facility must be saved.
Attis Station houses the Rift Alliance's finest minds. And the technology and weapons they've developed mustn't fall into Imperial hands.
What was the situation before Attis Station went silent?
Do you know what happened?
They sent a routine update, then we heard Imperial soldiers were in the area. Nothing more.
I will ensure it doesn't.
Thank you, thank you. I just wish I knew more about the situation there.
If I do this, I hope Attis Station will be ready to share its knowledge.
I'll expect a share.
We'll find out when we arrive, won't we, Jedi?
"We"? Young lady, you are not setting foot on Quesh! It's far too dangerous.
But, Father, Attis Station was built with our world's technology. If someone's using the defenses, I can get inside.
The faster I get in, the sooner I can protect the scientists there.
She has a point.
See, Father, we stand the best chance of saving everyone if I help.
If anything happened to you, I'd never forgive myself.
I don't want you hurt, Nadia.
You won't have to protect me, promise. Just focus on saving the station and our scientists.
As you wish, Nadia. Apparently, responsibility is a lesson you don't need.
Don't be so disobedient, child. It's his decision.
Listen to your father.
I'm not a child. It's our station too, and I want to help. I won't get in your way.
My daughter seems determined to help you, Jedi, like it or not.
Then it's settled. Once you're on Quesh's surface, I'll catch up with you. If our station's even scratched, I'll teach those Imperials a lesson.
A remarkable achievement. Balmorra couldn't ask for a better leader. Here, Jedi, I'll authorize Tai's request for Republic membership.
Hey, Tai, you'd better get started on an heir. Presidents have heirs, right?
You know, Nadia, I'm really going to miss you.
Jedi has what she wanted, Tai--Balmorra in the Republic. Now I want a seat in your government.
Tai, Jedi got his reward--Balmorra in the Republic. Mine? A seat in the new government, please.
I can't imagine you settling down to paperwork and election campaigning.
You, a politician?
I have fresh ideas.
I'm not sure about that.
It's the least you owe him.
Zenith deserves it, Tai.
I'm sorry, Zenith. You've proved your loyalty, but I won't have you in my government.
To truly free Balmorra, we must purge the ideas the Empire forced on us. You've learned too much from them.
Any shadow of the dark side could doom Balmorra before this rebirth has begun.
Tai is right.
Jedi speak. Always useful.
His dedication to your cause merits a reward.
So he gets nothing?
He's still an ally; he's not going away empty-handed.
That's not what you said when you needed Zenith's followers to die for you.
Quite the turnaround, Tai.
You become president. My men get unmarked graves.
I can compromise. I need a liaison between Balmorra and the Rift Alliance--and a berth here just opened up.
You'll have political pull and input on my decisions. Just not on Balmorra. Is that acceptable?
Huh. Jedi keeps a long view, makes tough choices. Might work.
Hmm. Jedi does what's necessary. Could work out.
Well, Jedi stays flexible. Smart. Might be interesting.
I've ordered thousands of new battle droids for the Republic. I'll stay in touch over holo.
Balmorra is waiting. I--and my planet--will never forget what you both did. Thank you.
My apologies, everyone, could you excuse us for a moment?
Jedi, I found something under our communications array. Look.
I don't recognize that. Did Tharan install it?
What is it?
Nadia, I know you're new to space travel, but you can't go around pulling pieces off a starship.
Don't dismantle my ship!
It just came off in my hand.
Please, it's been a long day.
Not now, Nadia.
I'm sorry, Jedi, but this is important.
The Republic database says it's an Imperial monitoring device.
Only someone on board would know where to plant it, right?
If someone was plotting against us, I would feel it.
I don't sense a traitor.
With so many people coming and going, anyone could have put it there.
Not necessarily.
The Empire knows a communications array when it sees one.
Imperial agents would too.
Maybe, but... I thought you should know. It deactivated itself when I picked it up, so it's safe now.
That, er, isn't our only concern.
You shoot anyone without my order, and there will be trouble.
Okay, but behave yourself.
Think the rebellion's out of my system.
I'm sure your skills and experience will continue to serve us well.
I'd welcome your help.
Sure, since Jedi attract fighting.
Balmorra. Home. I never wanted to see it like this.
I am--was--Balmorra's trade secretary. I was offworld when the Imperial occupation began, and my colleagues were exiled or killed. Our president....
...he was taken, and who knows what he's suffered? Hiding or not, I now have seniority. If we free Balmorra, I become president.
Balmorra's not a Republic world. Why is the Empire here?
What do the Imperials want?
Our droid manufacturing plants are fueling the Imperial war machine. They must be liberated!
The Empire must know that you're next in line. You're lucky to be alive.
You risk assassination.
Several Republic worlds protected me. I owe them everything.
The Imperial occupation has helped your career considerably.
How fortunate for you.
I never wanted this, but any other candidate may have been tainted by the Empire.
And once our government is restored, I want Balmorra to join the Republic.
As a Jedi, I must stop the suffering of your people.
A noble goal. Let me help.
Restoring the government will be no easy matter.
We need a strategy.
I have a plan. It's a little... unconventional.
And Balmorra's weapons and droids would then help the Republic Army, correct?
Along with your droid army.
Naturally. I don't expect you to help me for free.
Tai, this--it's madness! You d--don't have any supporters or soldiers, anything!
That will change. Meanwhile, I have a contact who can help us: a revolutionary calling himself "Zenith."
Zenith and his followers have been sabotaging the Empire's operations. Assassination, sneak attacks--he's something of a blunt instrument.
How can we place our trust in such a man?
He sounds dangerous.
Zenith is connected and he hates the Empire. I don't have the luxury of being judgmental.
How does Zenith fit into your plans?
What do you intend?
At least this Zenith is standing up to the Empire.
I like him already.
I need his knowledge and resources. But first, we have to find him.
When you're on the surface, go to this location and enter the phrase "two perspectives are aligned" into the computer there.
It'll get Zenith's attention. Hopefully, he'll be amenable.
Is there anything in particular you want me to tell him?
Do you have a message?
Say whatever you need to, just get him on our side.
I'll talk him around.
I will handle him according to my judgment, not yours.
I'll see when I meet him.
Best of luck. I've been... waiting to return for so long.
L--looks like we're safe. But, um, what happens now?
As I understand it, we've been given a Jedi Master to address our every need. Right?
My role is to take care of your problems, and prove the Republic respects and values you.
Something like that.
"Every need" may be a little strong. I'm here to secure your place in the Republic.
Not exactly....
Excellent, excellent. Shall I introduce everyone? First....
The Chancellor's seen you growing away from the Republic. I'm here to ensure that doesn't happen.
Wrong.
Er, yes, yes. I should introduce everyone. First, we have....
Representative Alauni, who can introduce herself.
This is Diab Duin. He represents a planet rich in... "lightsaber" crystals, you call them?
Yes. Beautiful things. Break easily.
Hello. Tai Cordan, trade secretary for Balmorra. You're the "Barsen'thor," the Warden of the Jedi Order, right?
Being a Jedi is honor enough. Barsen'thor is merely a ceremonial rank.
I'm no one special.
Yes. I didn't know my rank was common knowledge in the Republic.
You're very well informed.
You should feel honored, that someone of my rank would see to your grievances.
And you're lucky to have me.
Next is Shuuru. He's from a water planet called, er....
Manaan! Good to know my devastated world is so memorable!
I--I'm Blaesus. If you need any help from... not that you'd need... um, hello.
And I'm Senator Tobas Grell. My daughter and I are from Sarkhai; we've, ah, only just joined the Republic.
But we were invited to join this Rift Alliance almost right away. Wasn't that nice?
I'd love to hear all about your planet and culture, when we have time.
Newcomers? How fascinating.
Nice to meet everyone.
We certainly don't lack for diversity.
Quite the menagerie....
Ah, the Republic. Good at words, but nothing else. If you're really here to help us, prove it.
What about Tai? His world's under Imperial occupation, and the Republic's utterly failed to liberate them. Twice!
Alauni, there were good reasons for the Republic to pull out. Even I see that.
Although, if you did help to free Balmorra, Jedi, you'd certainly prove the Republic isn't a "failure"...
An Imperial occupation is reason enough to assist you.
I'd help you regardless.
No simple task, even for a Jedi.
Liberate an entire planet?
True, but I've had years to plan.
Technically Balmorra's not a Republic world, just a Republic ally. But the Empire didn't care.
Balmorra has never been part of the Republic. It's just an ally.
You're not a Republic world.
You know your politics. But things change.
Since the occupation, Balmorra's government has been in exile, myself included, and our droid factories are under Imperial control.
But, if Balmorra's liberated, I'll see we join the Republic. And bring our droid armies with us.
The Republic would be honored to have you.
We'd certainly welcome you.
In that case, I will see what I can do.
A fair exchange.
I shall hold you to that promise after we celebrate victory.
Droid armies sound promising.
The Republic actually helping Balmorra? That would be... a start.
Now more than ever, we must stand together. And I will prove how much the Republic cares about you.
We must work as one.
If Balmorra's people are suffering under the Empire, we shouldn't waste time.
Then I should begin.
Either we work together, or the Empire will destroy us. You'll see the Republic's true strength, but we expect your full support in return.
You have to cooperate with me.
Well, the Fortitude's done for. It seems we're stuck here. At least we can keep an eye on things.
Yes, that s-sounds like a good idea.
On a Jedi's ship! I never dreamed I'd--I can't wait to see everything!
I choose who does or does not travel on my ship, and Zenith doesn't.
No. I'm not taking him.
I apologize. In that case... maybe a field position fighting the Empire?
Acceptable. For now.
We should go. Thank you, Jedi. I--and Balmorra--owe you everything.
We'll see, Zenith.
